word_mean: 裂殖：无性生殖的一种形式，细胞分裂为两个或更多相同大小的子代，每个子代成为一新的、独立的生物体
主要见于单细胞生物，如细菌。另见binary f.和multiple f.

sentence.Network_en: The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals.
sentence.Network_cn: 细胞的裂变可以通过某些化学药品加以抑制.

sentence.Network_en: All commercial nuclear power is provided by fission at the present time.
sentence.Network_cn: 目前所有的商用核动力都是通过核裂变产生的.

sentence.Network_en: Nuclear fission releases tremendous amounts of energy.
sentence.Network_cn: 核裂变释放出巨大的能量.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin fissio(n-), from findere 'to split'

entry.def: Nuclear fission is the splitting of the nucleus of an atom to produce a large amount of energy or cause a large explosion.

means.word_mean: 1. a nuclear reaction in which a massive nucleus splits into smaller nuclei with the simultaneous release of energy
2. reproduction of some unicellular organisms by division of the cell into two more or less equal parts
